name: bigquery-runner
description: An extension for querying Google Cloud Platform's BigQuery analytics datasets directly from VS Code.

commands.title: BigQuery: Run selected text as Query

bigqueryRunner.keyFilename.description: (Required) Full path to the a .json, .pem, or .p12 key downloaded from the Google Developers Console. If you provide a path to a JSON file, the projectId option is not necessary. NOTE: .pem and .p12 require you to specify the email option as well.

bigqueryRunner.projectId.description: (Optional) The project ID from the Google Developer's Console, e.g. 'grape-spaceship-123'. This is NOT needed if you are provide a key in JSON format

bigqueryRunner.location.description: (Optional) The geographic location of the job. Required except for US and EU. See details at https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/dataset-locations#specifying_your_location.

bigqueryRunner.useLegacySql.description: (Optional) Specifies whether to use BigQuery's legacy SQL dialect for this query. The default value is true. If set to false, the query will use BigQuery's standard SQL: https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/sql-reference/

bigqueryRunner.maximumBytesBilled.description: (Optional) Limits the bytes billed for this job. Queries that will have bytes billed beyond this limit will fail (without incurring a charge). If unspecified, this will be set to your project default.

bigqueryRunner.outputFormat.description: (Optional) Controls the output format for query results.

bigqueryRunner.prettyPrintJSON.description: (Optional) Pretty print JSON results when outputFormat is specified as json.

bigqueryRunner.preserveFocus.description: (Optional) Preserve focus when opening output window.

scripts.pretest: npm run compile && npm run lint
